indexmap.h

00001 // indexmap.h copyright 2007 Cycling '74 all rights reserved
00002 
00003 #ifndef _INDEXMAP_H_
00004 #define _INDEXMAP_H_
00005 
00006 BEGIN_USING_C_LINKAGE
00007 
00008 
00009 #ifndef t_systhread_mutex
00010 typedef void *t_systhread_mutex;
00011 #endif
00012 
00013 
00014 /** An indexmap element. This struct is provided for debugging convenience, 
00015     but should be considered opaque and is subject to change without notice. 
00016 
00017     @ingroup indexmap
00018     @see t_indexmap
00019 */
00020 typedef struct _indexmap_entry
00021 {
00022     long    e_index;
00023     void    *e_data;
00024     long    e_mark;
00025 } t_indexmap_entry;
00026 
00027 
00028 /** An indexmap object. This struct is provided for debugging convenience, 
00029     but should be considered opaque and is subject to change without notice. 
00030 
00031     @ingroup indexmap
00032     @see t_indexmap_entry
00033 */
00034 typedef struct _indexmap
00035 {
00036     t_object m_ob;
00037     t_hashtab *m_data2index;            // convert from a data reference to an indexmap_entry (and hence index)
00038     t_indexmap_entry **m_index2data;    // convert from an index to a data reference
00039     long m_i2dsize;                     // size of index2data array
00040     long m_count;                       // how many items
00041     t_systhread_mutex m_mutex;          // protector
00042 } t_indexmap;
00043 
00044 
00045 // private -- initialize the indexmap class
00046 void indexmap_initclass();
00047 
00048 
00049 /** Create a new indexmap object.
00050 
00051     @ingroup indexmap
00052     @return Pointer to the new indexmap object.
00053 */
00054 t_indexmap *indexmap_new(void);
00055 
00056 
00057 /** Add an item to an indexmap.
00058 
00059     @ingroup        indexmap
00060     @param  x       The indexmap instance.
00061     @param  data    The item to add.
00062 */
00063 void indexmap_append(t_indexmap *x, void *data);
00064 
00065 
00066 /** Move an item to a different position in an indexmap.
00067 
00068     @ingroup            indexmap
00069     @param  x           The indexmap instance.
00070     @param  data        The item in the indexmap to move.
00071     @param  newindex    The new index to which to move the item.
00072     @return             A Max error code.
00073 */
00074 t_max_err indexmap_move(t_indexmap *x, void *data, long newindex);
00075 
00076 
00077 /** Delete a specified item from an indexmap.
00078 
00079     @ingroup        indexmap
00080     @param  x       The indexmap instance.
00081     @param  data    The item pointer to remove from the indexmap.
00082     @return         A Max error code.
00083 */
00084 t_max_err indexmap_delete(t_indexmap *x, void *data);
00085 
00086 
00087 /** Delete an item from the indexmap by index.
00088 
00089     @ingroup        indexmap
00090     @param  x       The indexmap instance.
00091     @param  index   The index of the item to remove from the indexmap.
00092     @return         A Max error code.
00093 */
00094 t_max_err indexmap_delete_index(t_indexmap *x, long index);
00095 
00096 
00097 /** Delete multiple specified items from an indexmap.
00098 
00099     @ingroup        indexmap
00100     @param  x       The indexmap instance.
00101     @param  count   The number of items to remove from the indexmap.
00102     @param  pdata   The address of the first of an array of item pointers to remove from the indexmap.
00103     @return         A Max error code.
00104 */
00105 t_max_err indexmap_delete_multi(t_indexmap *x, long count, void **pdata);
00106 
00107 
00108 /** Delete multiple items from an indexmap by index.
00109 
00110     @ingroup        indexmap
00111     @param  x       The indexmap instance.
00112     @param  count   The number of items to remove from the indexmap.
00113     @param  indices The address of the first of an array of index numbers to remove the indexmap.
00114     @return         A Max error code.
00115 */
00116 t_max_err indexmap_delete_index_multi(t_indexmap *x, long count, long *indices);
00117 
00118 
00119 /** Get an item from an indexmap by index.
00120 
00121     @ingroup        indexmap
00122     @param  x       The indexmap instance.
00123     @param  index   The index from which to fetch a stored item.
00124     @return         The item stored at the specified index.
00125 */
00126 void *indexmap_datafromindex(t_indexmap *x, long index);
00127 
00128 
00129 /** Find the index of an item given a pointer to the item.
00130 
00131     @ingroup        indexmap
00132     @param  x       The indexmap instance.
00133     @param  data    The item whose index you wish to look up.
00134     @param  index   The address of a variable to hold the retrieved index.
00135     @return         A Max error code.
00136 */
00137 t_max_err indexmap_indexfromdata(t_indexmap *x, void *data, long *index);
00138 
00139 
00140 /** Return the number of items in an indexmap.
00141 
00142     @ingroup    indexmap
00143     @param  x   The indexmap instance.
00144     @return     The number of items in the indexmap.
00145 */
00146 long indexmap_getsize(t_indexmap *x);
00147 
00148 
00149 /** Delete all items in an indexmap.
00150 
00151     @ingroup    indexmap
00152     @param  x   The indexmap instance.
00153 */
00154 void indexmap_clear(t_indexmap *x);
00155 
00156 
00157 /** Sort the items in an indexmap.
00158     Item are sorted using a #t_cmpfn function that is passed in as an argument.
00159 
00160     @ingroup indexmap
00161     @param  x   The indexmap instance.
00162     @param  fn  The function used to sort the list.
00163     @see    linklist_sort()
00164 */
00165 void indexmap_sort(t_indexmap *x, t_cmpfn fn);
00166 
00167 
00168 END_USING_C_LINKAGE
00169 
00170 #endif // _INDEXMAP_H_
